snippet: The argument is bogus that corporations leave the U.S. and set up overseas because of high corporate tax rates.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column rejects argument that companies are fleeing the United States to pursue so-called 'corporate-inversions' because of high corporate tax rates; says in reality, most US corporations end up paying far lower than the 35 percent rate, and that inversions are attractive because they allow companies to avoid paying repatriation taxes, among other loopholes; holds these loopholes can be closed without the need for a broad overhaul of corporate taxes.
lead_paragraph: The argument is bogus that corporations leave the U.S. and set up overseas because of high corporate tax rates.
